thread.title: Le'Veon Bell Reportedly Underwent Surgery to Repair Core Muscle Injury
thread.title_full: Le'Veon Bell Reportedly Underwent Surgery to Repair Core Muscle Injury

author: Tyler Conway
title: Le'Veon Bell Reportedly Underwent Surgery to Repair Core Muscle Injury
text: Le'Veon Bell Reportedly Underwent Surgery to Repair Core Muscle Injury Jim Rogash/Getty Images Tyler Conway Featured Columnist March 13, 2017 Pittsburgh Steelers running back Le'Veon Bell underwent surgery to repair a core muscle injury and is expected to have a recovery timeline of six weeks. On Monday, Ian Rapoport of NFL Network reported news of the procedure, which fixed a problem that surfaced during the Steelers' AFC Championship Game loss to the New England Patriots . Bell delayed the procedure, and Rapoport indicated last month it was unlikely he needed surgery. More to follow.
